Reviews.Title: “scottish girls”
Reviews.Author: weekendscotchgirls
Reviews.Content: was staying at this travelodge which was much more modernised than its counterpart across the road in drury lane although both were clean and staff friendly and helpful. Drury lane's reception had soft leather couches near the bar but holburn only had the chairs you sat on for breakfast so rather uncomfy. The bathrooms were modernised and the room was much the same clean and large and quiet. Great location for all the shows and oxford street 10 mins away albeit the central point end, five mins away from hamleys etc... The breakfast was good and great choices . The only fault both travelodges had was when you were standing at the bar waiting for assistance you waited a while as bar staff doubled up as reception staff and if someone came in to register you had to wait . Other than that , good locoation for the money. Been twice in the last three months whereas if we had stayed in the dearer hotels we normally stayed in probably could not have afforded it so soon so Travelodge we are coming again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: Jayne F
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the family for 4 nights. Rooms clean and beds comfy. Thats where the good stuff ends. Rooms not cleaned, just clean towels, thats all. Left note about broken kettle - ignored. tea bags etc not topped up. No hairdryer. Faulty sockets - big problem when trying to charge up electronic gadgets etc. Breakfast was a disaster every day. It was half term but bar area not big enough for size of hotel. Had to que for table at breakfast and then had to wait for food - on the last day there was no bowls, spoons, milk, bread, cups and glasses. The staff were doing their best but they just didn't have enough crockery to cope. The poor staff were hand washing dishes behing the bar to try and cope. Also quite noisy at night but it is central London so to b expected. We booked these rooms in the sale so were pretty cheap and also with the "kids eat free" offer for breakfast it was great value but if the hotel can't cope its not much good. Avoid in school holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre...needs a facelift.”
Reviews.Author: JD60
Reviews.Content: I was tempted by the Travelodge Room Sale and decided to return to this hotel once again having stayed there on a few occasions over the years. This time I had moved from a 4* nearby so it probably coloured my opinion on how spartan and soulless Travelodges can be. They do the job...just. When this hotel was new and fresh it was ideal for reasonably priced stays in a perfect, safe, central London location. It probably still is, but this time the continual whiff of what seemed to be old cooking oil in the foyer/lift area, the stained carpets, manky kettle and mismatched curtains (one curtain about 6" shorter than the other on the same window) left one with the opinion that even 2* standards are slipping at the TL High Holborn. That said, I had a great sleep in a quiet and very spacious room. I would stay again but definitely only at a very good sale rate and would be sorely disappointed if I had paid the Travelodge rates sometimes quoted when there are so many good 4* available in central London at the same price or less.

Reviews.Title: “beware of nighclub noise throughout the night until 07.00am”
Reviews.Author: coventry58
Reviews.Content: My previous visits to travelodge covent garden ( high holborn) have been good , the rooms allocated then were facing the high holborn street, they were ok . But a word of warning to you if you visit now , On the 3rd and 4th of january 2012 ,my rooms were 614? and 1366 ,both facing museum st / near west central street a night club called "paradox" is nearby in a small street called west central street, next to a taxi rank. paradox nightclub starts at 01.00am until 07.00am and the noise from the heavy beat music carries along the road which acts as a echo chamber and wakes you up, along with this,many people converge outside the club and the taxi rank to smoke and talk and have a laugh ... again the sound travels along the road and together with the music it is impossible to sleep once you are woken. the first night this happend , i went to reception at 3.45am to let them know about the noise , the staff were sympathetic but could do nothing, they offered me a new room but said the noise would be the same so i stayed in the same room but did not sleep at all. second night, same noise again, went to reception at around 3.45am, this time i ask the staff for the police to come , to see and hear the anti social noise coming from inside and outside the club and put a stop to it , the staff refused to call them saying they have been out many times in the past, they will not come out again. their security man intervened added you should have known about the noise , it tells you on the website before you book, i replied it says nothing about noise until 7am in the morning. i said if you were aware that the noise was that bad and went on until 7.00am why was i not made aware before been given the room. they did not comment, but did apologise. at 4.00 am i went to look for another hotel, but all hotels were out of my price range. returned to the travelodge high holborn later in the morning around breakfast time . went to my room and slept solid until 2.00pm to catch up with my sleep. therefore missing out on sightseeing or a theatre show. deputy manager refunded my room fee for the 2 nights, but no compensation for 2 days of disrupted sleep or no sleep at all. The manager of high holborn does not inform staff to tell you that the nightclub goes on until 7am , this is i assume kept from you as they dont want to lose your custom i would make sure you dont get a room facing museum street or west central street. hopefully travelodge will take the night club to court to get it closed. but until then be careful of what room you get. p. s. went to travelodge tower bridge the next night , slept good all night. my advice to travelodge is to install 1st class triple glazing to hide any future noise travelodge is normally ok , but loss of sleep for 2 nights is not on. thanks ......

Reviews.Title: “Mattresses were absolutely shocking!”
Reviews.Author: Muzza73
Reviews.Content: This hotel remains valur for money given the location but the mattresses were absolutely terrible. We changed rooms after the first night and it wasn't much better! I would be reluctant to stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here if you actually want to get some sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Sullyship
Reviews.Content: Although the location is fairly well placed for easy access to London attractiosn, the room was basic, didn't feel particularly clean, and over priced for what you got. As we just turned up in London it was a booking out of desparation as hadnt expected to stay here overnight. The worst part was the club outside the hotel had banging music and drunken banter til 6am, so don't expect to get any sleep. This is fine if you're also on a big night out or hen/stag do, but not so great otherwise. Would not stay here again unless was in one of these situations. Nice pub (White Hart) across the road on Drury Lane though, and cheap excellent breakfast at Drury Lane cafe too.

Reviews.Title: “better than covent garden”
Reviews.Author: iylr
Reviews.Content: We were originally allocated a room in the Travelodge Covent Garden for our event, but due to a mix-up 4 people were allocated the same room, and I moved to the High Holborn Travelodge just round the corner. The bar area is smaller, but it was more brightly-lit and felt cosier than the dim and cage-like bar area of the covent garden travelodge. Internet is available for a pound (you'd need a pound coin though). The room in High Holborn seems cleaner and newer compared to the room in covent garden. Noise isn't much of a problem, though it does carry if you have the misfortune of having a hen party roaming the streets in the early hours of dawn.

Reviews.Title: “Worked Very Well For A Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: OldiePlymouth_UK
Reviews.Content: The booking was made by our son-in-law, so we checked-in at Travelodge Covent Garden where the taxi left us. It turned out that our family was booked into Travelodge High Holborn, just around the corner. Reception at Covent Garden realised this and found us a room at Holborn very quickly, and also issued the passkey. This short confusion was quickly resolved, but it could have been a problem for less-mobile guests; we simply picked up our bags and walked. The room (two adults) was spacious, clean and everything worked. The family, however, (two adults and two children) found their room noisy during the night; street noise rising to floor eight. They do live in a small country village, however, and conceded that city noise was unusual for them. Their family room too was spacious and clean. As a central London base for a winter holiday this place was hard to beat, but the included breakfast was something of a scrum. The food was plentiful and varied, but not enough room for the numbers. This was especially so as we, like other families, were trying to sit together having been joined by our other daughter and her husband: therefore 6 adults and two children. Our solution was to take breakfast early at the very beginning of the meal period. This meant that we could sit together at two adjoining tables and the staff seemed better able to cope. All-in-all, however, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: bouvierspessac
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in such a run down shabby hotel. The reception area was ok, staff not on the ball, asked for a room with a bath got one with a shower, changed twice. Lifts and corridors to them were so shabby, no proper security on guest area, people just walked in.Rubbish on floor, paint missing from walls and disgusting floor. Room was very tired,, carpet stained and worn out in places, wardrobe was bits of old mdf joined together.Wall paper hanging off walls, electric fire had a notice saying, "this appliance has been disconnected for your safety." The bathroom was dirty, sink cracked, bath enamel missing, vanity unit was a disgrace, tiles missing. Breakfast buffet was ok as but drink machine was filthy, orange juice machine had more water in it that orange and the cutlery was wet and dirty. The whole experience was not pleasant. Have written to them, no reply very bad customer service.

Reviews.Title: “great location. very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: dorit55
Reviews.Content: great great location. very basic rooms don't expect nothing from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Noisey nightclub”
Reviews.Author: Carltona
Reviews.Content: Pretty much echo all that has been said before. We paid Â£29 a night. For that it was fine - location in particular is superb BUT the noise from the nightclubs around the back ruined our stay - honestly, the music didn't stop until 4 am but the noise - shouting etc - went on til 5. If possible I would try to request staying at the Travelodge across the road on Drury Lane - we've stayed there before, it's much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “suited us just fine”
Reviews.Author: londongirl68
Reviews.Content: stayed at high holburn so we were close to theatreland. got tickets for oliver and pleased to find it was 6 or 7 minutes walk from hotel. staff were lovely and helpful and room was lovely and clean. must admit we'd read reviews and were not expecting much but were very happily surprised. sat in bar after returning from show and bar staff was lovely as well. went to breakfast for 8 when it opened, seems best time because it fills up quickly but service was great and we all enjoyed different choices to eat. we were at the back of the hotel on the 6th floor, i slept like a log, husband is a light sleeper and was woke by sirens outside about 5 in morning but this is hardly travelodges fault! we decided during the first day it is somewhere we would use again. Â£101 for a family room and its 2mins walk from holburn underground on the piccadilly line. seems like a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but not tempted to stay again”
Reviews.Author: BoldlyGO
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on High Holborn though the website warns it is split across two close nearby sites. I arrived at the right check in and was booked into a room on the 2nd floor, facing High Holborn itself. The reception was okay but my card key only got me thro the first door but not into the room. I had to go back downstairs where a disbelieving second member of staff took their time sorting out a replacement. No apologies were offered. The room itself was on a dog leg but quite large (267). Furnishings were sparse but usuable. The bed was quite comfortable. The bathroom hand basin had a very large crack in it which is not excusable these days. It was not fitted with a plug, risking wasted water. The traffic noise was not troublesome nor rowdy passers by. I slept quite well. Breakfast was very standard fare with no sparky staff to set you up. Bar prices I noticed were expensive even for London. The saving grace is the location- it being a few minutes walk from theatre land, Soho, China town, Bllomsbury etc. If you wanted a budget break in London, this may be for you.

Reviews.Title: “People barged in my room twice during my stay, room untidy, they offered to wake me up to catch my plane but they forgot”
Reviews.Author: deionara
Reviews.Content: I previously stayed at the Travelodge on Drury Lane, but heard that the one on High Holborn has newer rooms. Luckily I only stayed for 2 nights there. When I checked in they had a system failure (which is fair enough because they don't have control over this kind of things) but when I was in my room someone from staff opened the door with the card without even knocking first! In the middle of the NIGHT, I woke up with a MAN in my room - he got checked in the same room as me!!! I was terrified! I'm laughing about it now, but I can imagine that someone else could have even stolen my things, money or jewelry, had I not been inside the room at the time. The room was very untidy, carpet was really dirty, it was cold (there was a heater but not effective and had to sleep with a sweater on top of my pijamas), linoleum in the bathroom was falling apart and other than that the room was very basic. I had to checkout at 4 in the morning to catch my plane, and they offered to wake me up but they FORGOT!! Luckily I also had my alarm and managed to catch the plane, but I'm sure that they wouldn't have reimbursed me, had I missed my flight.

Reviews.Title: “Noise all night from clubs next door”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkit
Reviews.Content: There are clubs right next door to this hotel that go on until daylight. We were 8 floors up and the noise did not relent. Shouting, screeching car tyres, horns blasting, it was unbeievable. We complained and after an extensive arguement a refund was given. They even tried telling us to complain to the local council instead of them !! Accept your room with care.

Reviews.Title: “Busy”
Reviews.Author: CliffWalker
Reviews.Content: This basic and, for London, cheap hotel is ideally located for the West End. It has a NCP Garage next door where you can leave your car - at a price! Most of the personnel with whom we came in contact were charming and helpful. The rooms are basic but clean and reasonably well equipped. The dining room was extremely busy while we were there and we declined to wait for admission on our second morning.

Reviews.Title: “ok is about all i can say”
Reviews.Author: Zen1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel about a week ago. I work for a government department and thus they only allow a limited budget for hotels so thsi was my only option in central london. I paid Â£65 for one night but i know if i'd booked it earlier i could have got a room for Â£49 so value is excellent. There are two Travelodge Hotels within 50 meters of each other on Dury Lane in Covent Garden. I stayed in the one at the end of Dury Lane called the High Holborn Travel Lodge. I arrievd at 12noon and just wanted to drop my bags off but i was told there was no facility for left luggage and i would have to either keep them with me or pay Â£10 for an early check in. I had a big bag so i had little choice but to pay Â£10 and check in. The lifts were tatty and well worn, the room was big and on the 11th floor and had a good view over the city. There was a huge space that looked like it should have been where a sofa would go but there was no sofa. The bathroom was basic and there were no towels in the room at all so i grabbed some fresh ones off one of the celaning carts down the corridoor. However these were still stained with brown and blue stains. The shower was excellent and very powerful. The bed was comfy and the room was quiet. TV was of a good quality for a budget hotel. I think in future i'd pay an extra Â£20 or so and get a nicer hotel even just for a night. It did have a slight seedy feel about it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: beverlyblue
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two night stay in the Covent Garden building in this twin location hotel. I will agree that it is a great location, but the hotel is a bit dull and is older in comparison to the high Holborn hotel. One thing that really did annoy me about this hotel is the do not answer the phone even if you go through central reservations to speak to the hotel direct they still don't answer I let the phone ring for 1/2 hour with no success. When we checked in we mentioned this and the receptionist just said they were busy! we observed the receptionsit walking away from a ringing phone after cheking us in. Our room was basic but clean all that you would expect of a travel lodge, its a bit noisy but when next door moved in we thought they were in the room with us. Being a former office block obviously sound proofing is not a premium. I think Â£105 is a bit extortionate for the hotel especially when Holiday Inn express are charging the same rate with better servcie, But it's all about location, location , location and for that you can't beat it. If I were to book again I would request a room in the High Holborn hotel>

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: slm1
Reviews.Content: If you want a central location at reasonable price then this hotel must be in the running. The location of this hotel is a huge plus in its favour, its very central and walking distance to lots of theatres and major attractions. We stayed Mon to Fri at Â£105 per night plus Â£7.50 p/p for buffet breakfast, this is top price but I did leave it a bit late to expect a cheap deal. As already reviewed the room (1363 ) is basic but for this location and price I doubt you will get any better. The staff were all polite and efficient so no complaints on that front either. Buffet b/fast was the usual cereals/juice, and bacon/sausage/ beans/ mushrooms/scrambled egg/toast, not cheap at Â£7.50 p/p but it wasnt a rip off either. I would use this hotel again but would be looking to book in advance to get a cheaper deal next time. I would say the High Holborn is better situated than the Covent Garden.

Reviews.Title: “very clean nad comfortable”
Reviews.Author: londoneye_7
Reviews.Content: stayed at this travel lodge for 4 nights mid week. was very pleasantly surprised when we saw the room. It was very spacious indeed and our only complaint was that the television was too far away from the bed! The room was spotless and the bathroom the same. There was lots of storage space and as we were off the main corridor, there was no hotel noise, but we could, of course, hear the traffic outside,and a disco going on while early hours was a bit of a nuisance on one of the nights. the corridors etc were also very clean, the reception desk very helpful and towels changed daily. would certainly recommend this travel lodge and we will definitely go bacj k.

Reviews.Title: “A return visit and as good as ever.”
Reviews.Author: JD60
Reviews.Content: Just back form a three-night return stay at Travelodge High Holborn. The stay averaged about Â£50 per night. Saturday nights are usually at full price of Â£89 but Fridays/Sundays are often discounted so the combination is generally very reasonable. This is the FIRST hotel (listed as Travelodge Covent Garden on their website) that I check for availability when visiting London. If you want expensive artwork on the walls, antique furniture, and goldplated taps, go elsewhere. On the other hand, if you want an unbeatable location, efficient friendly staff and huge, comfortable, no-frills, clean rooms, then this is THE hotel to stay at in central london. The hotel is a credit to its manager. As I stated in an earlier review, its sister-hotel across the street in Covent Garden is older and is not nearly as fresh or inviting so when checking in, go to the Holborn check-in and request a room in the Holborn building. You will not be disappointed. Once again, "well done" to all at Travelodge High Holborn.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: Axwell
Reviews.Content: This is a standard Travelodge with the associated pluses and minuses. The room and hotel generally was in decent condition and the location is excellent. There were two disappointments/surprises for us. Firstly the housekeeping wasn't very reliable or good, though the staff were very friendly and tried to be helpful. Secondly (something we have never come across before), when we checked out (by 12.00) there was nowhere we could leave our case and so we were forced to lug it around with us until it was time to go to the airport. This issue would probably prevent us returning in similar travelling circumstances We booked late and paid the full rate which is extortionate for a Travelodge generally but probably represents acceptable value in central London The Hotel is wheelchair accessible

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge High Holborn
HotelInfo.Address: 166 High Holborn, London WC1V 6TT, England
